title: 2013 U.S. Women's Open
text:
The 2013 U.S. Women's Open was the 68th <a href="U.S.%20Women%27s%20Open">U.S. Women's Open</a>, held June 27–30 at <a href="Sebonack%20Golf%20Club">Sebonack Golf Club</a> in <a href="Southampton%2C%20New%20York">Southampton, New York</a>. It was first time the championship was played on <a href="Long%20Island">Long Island</a> and marked a return to the greater <a href="New%20York%20City">New York City</a> area, which last hosted the U.S. Women's Open in <a href="1987%20U.S.%20Women%27s%20Open">1987</a>. <a href="Inbee%20Park">Inbee Park</a> won her second U.S. Women's Open title, four strokes ahead of runner-up <a href="I.K.%20Kim">I.K. Kim</a>. It was Park's fourth <a href="Women%27s%20major%20golf%20championships">major</a> title and third consecutive in <a href="2013%20LPGA%20Tour">2013</a>. She is the first to win the opening three majors of a season since <a href="Babe%20Zaharias">Babe Zaharias</a> in 1950. The event was televised by <a href="ESPN">ESPN</a> and <a href="NBC%20Sports">NBC Sports</a>.
The U.S. Women's Open is the oldest of the five current <a href="Women%27s%20major%20golf%20championships">major championships</a> and was the third of the <a href="2013%20LPGA%20Tour">2013</a> season. Along with <a href="The%20Evian%20Championship">The Evian Championship</a>, it had the largest purse in women's golf in 2013, at <a href="United%20States%20dollar">$</a>3.25 million. It is one of 16 individual or team championships conducted by the <a href="United%20States%20Golf%20Association">United States Golf Association</a> (USGA).
Qualifying and field.
The championship was open to any female professional or amateur golfer with a USGA <a href="Handicap%20%28golf%29">handicap</a> index not exceeding 4.4. Players qualified by competing in one of twenty 36-hole qualifying tournaments that were held between May 7 and May 30 at sites across the United States. Additional players were exempt from qualifying because of past performances in professional or amateur tournaments around the world.
A record 1,420 entries were received for the championship, surpassing the previous record of 1,364 in <a href="2012%20U.S.%20Women%27s%20Open">2012</a>.
Exempt from qualifying.
Many players were exempt in multiple categories. Players are listed only once, in the first category in which they became exempt, with additional categories in parentheses ( ) next to their names. Golfers qualifying in Category 12 who qualify by more than one method are also denoted with the tour by which they qualified.
1. Winners of the U.S. Women's Open for the last ten years (2003–2012)
<a href="Birdie%20Kim">Birdie Kim</a>, <a href="Cristie%20Kerr">Cristie Kerr</a> (4,8,9,11,13,14), <a href="Inbee%20Park">Inbee Park</a> (5,7,8,9,10,11,13,14), <a href="Eun-Hee%20Ji">Eun-Hee Ji</a> (9), <a href="Paula%20Creamer">Paula Creamer</a> (8,9,13,14), <a href="So%20Yeon%20Ryu">So Yeon Ryu</a> (9,10,11,13,14), <a href="Na%20Yeon%20Choi">Na Yeon Choi</a> (8,9,10,11,13,14)
2. Winner and runner-up from the 2012 <a href="U.S.%20Women%27s%20Amateur">U.S. Women's Amateur</a> (must be an amateur)
<a href="Lydia%20Ko">Lydia Ko</a> (4,11,13,14) (winner). The runner-up, <a href="Jaye%20Marie%20Green">Jaye Marie Green</a>, turned professional in August 2012 and was no longer exempt from qualifying. She attempted, and failed, to qualify at the Heathrow, Florida qualifying tournament on May 28.
3. Winner of the 2013 <a href="British%20Ladies%20Amateur">British Ladies Amateur</a> (must be an amateur)
<a href="Georgia%20Hall">Georgia Hall</a> (declined to participate)
4. Winner of the 2012 <a href="Mark%20H.%20McCormack%20Medal">Mark H. McCormack Medal</a> (Women's World Amateur Golf Ranking) (must be an amateur)
"The winner, Lydia Ko, is already qualified in Category 2."
5. Winners of the <a href="LPGA%20Championship">LPGA Championship</a> for the last five years (2009–2013)
<a href="Anna%20Nordqvist">Anna Nordqvist</a> (9,14), <a href="Yani%20Tseng">Yani Tseng</a> (6,7,9,10,13,14), <a href="Shanshan%20Feng">Shanshan Feng</a> (8,9, 12-LET,13,14)
6. Winners of the <a href="Ricoh%20Women%27s%20British%20Open">Ricoh Women's British Open</a> for the last five years (2008–2012)
<a href="Jiyai%20Shin">Jiyai Shin</a> (9,10,11,13,14), <a href="Catriona%20Matthew">Catriona Matthew</a> (9,13,14)
7. Winners of the <a href="Kraft%20Nabisco%20Championship">Kraft Nabisco Championship</a> for the last five years (2009–2013)
<a href="Brittany%20Lincicome">Brittany Lincicome</a> (9,13), <a href="Stacy%20Lewis">Stacy Lewis</a> (9,10,11,13,14), <a href="Sun%20Young%20Yoo">Sun Young Yoo</a> (9)
8. Ten lowest scorers and anyone tying for 10th place from the 2012 U.S. Women's Open Championship
<a href="Amy%20Yang">Amy Yang</a> (9,13,14), <a href="Sandra%20Gal">Sandra Gal</a> (9), <a href="Ilhee%20Lee">Ilhee Lee</a> (9,11), <a href="Giulia%20Sergas">Giulia Sergas</a> (9), <a href="Mika%20Miyazato">Mika Miyazato</a> (9,11,13,14), <a href="Se%20Ri%20Pak">Se Ri Pak</a> (9), <a href="Suzann%20Pettersen">Suzann Pettersen</a> (9,10,11,13.14), <a href="Nicole%20Castrale">Nicole Castrale</a> (9)

Kim</a> (10,13,14), <a href="Karine%20Icher">Karine Icher</a> (14), <a href="Candie%20Kung">Candie Kung</a>, <a href="Haeji%20Kang">Haeji Kang</a>, <a href="Jenny%20Shin">Jenny Shin</a>, <a href="Julieta%20Granada">Julieta Granada</a> (12-LET), <a href="Beatriz%20Recari">Beatriz Recari</a> (10,11,14), <a href="Hee%20Young%20Park">Hee Young Park</a>, <a href="Vicky%20Hurst">Vicky Hurst</a>, <a href="Katherine%20Hull-Kirk">Katherine Hull-Kirk</a>, <a href="Meena%20Lee">Meena Lee</a>, <a href="Jessica%20Korda">Jessica Korda</a>, <a href="Natalie%20Gulbis">Natalie Gulbis</a>, <a href="Karin%20Sj%C3%B6din">Karin Sjödin</a> (withdrew), <a href="Mina%20Harigae">Mina Harigae</a>, <a href="Morgan%20Pressel">Morgan Pressel</a>, <a href="Hee-Won%20Han">Hee-Won Han</a>, <a href="Katie%20Futcher">Katie Futcher</a>, <a href="Gerina%20Piller">Gerina Piller</a>, <a href="Lindsey%20Wright">Lindsey Wright</a>, <a href="Jennifer%20Johnson%20%28golfer%29">Jennifer Johnson</a> (11), <a href="Lizette%20Salas">Lizette Salas</a> (10,13,14), <a href="Danielle%20Kang">Danielle Kang</a>, <a href="Cindy%20LaCrosse">Cindy LaCrosse</a>, <a href="Pornanong%20Phatlum">Pornanong Phatlum</a>, <a href="Jodi%20Ewart%20Shadoff">Jodi Ewart Shadoff</a>, <a href="Caroline%20Hedwall">Caroline Hedwall</a>, <a href="Momoko%20Ueda">Momoko Ueda</a>, <a href="Mi%20Jung%20Hur">Mi Jung Hur</a>, <a href="Mariajo%20Uribe">Mariajo Uribe</a>, <a href="Alison%20Walshe">Alison Walshe</a>, <a href="Sydnee%20Michaels">Sydnee Michaels</a>, <a href="Mo%20Martin">Mo Martin</a>, <a href="Michelle%20Wie">Michelle Wie</a>, <a href="Sophie%20Gustafson">Sophie Gustafson</a>, <a href="Dewi%20Claire%20Schreefel">Dewi Claire Schreefel</a>, <a href="Sarah%20Jane%20Smith%20%28golfer%29">Sarah Jane Smith</a>, <a href="Bel%C3%A9n%20Mozo">Belén Mozo</a>, <a href="Jimin%20Kang">Jimin Kang</a> (withdrew), <a href="Pernilla%20Lindberg">Pernilla Lindberg</a>

"All players already qualified in other categories."

Qualifiers.
Additional players qualified for the 2013 U.S. Women's Open through one of the sectional qualifying tournaments. At sites with multiple qualifiers, players are listed in order of qualifying scores, from lowest score to highest.
May 7 at The Eldridge Club, Baltimore, Maryland
<a href="Christina%20Kim">Christina Kim</a>, <a href="Irene%20Cho">Irene Cho</a>, <a href="Thidapa%20Suwannapura">Thidapa Suwannapura</a>, <a href="Maude-Aimee%20Leblanc">Maude-Aimee Leblanc</a>, <a href="Taylore%20Karle">Taylore Karle</a>, <a href="Nicole%20Jeray">Nicole Jeray</a>, <a href="Felicity%20Johnson%20%28golfer%29">Felicity Johnson</a>, <a href="Paz%20Echeverria">Paz Echeverria</a>, <a href="Tiffany%20Joh">Tiffany Joh</a>, <a href="Janice%20Moodie">Janice Moodie</a>, <a href="Stephanie%20Sherlock">Stephanie Sherlock</a>

Alternates added to field.
The following players were added to the field on June 10 when spots reserved for players qualifying in various categories, including 5, 10, 12, and 13, were not used.
<a href="Danah%20Bordner">Danah Bordner</a>, the second alternate from the Baltimore qualifier, was added to the field on June 12 when Jimin Kang, who qualified in category 9, withdrew from the tournament.
<a href="Ryann%20O%27Toole">Ryann O'Toole</a>, the first alternate from the Boylston, Massachusetts qualifier, was added to the field on June 24 when Karin Sjödin who qualified in category 9, withdrew from the tournament citing a shoulder injury.
<a href="Christel%20Boeljon">Christel Boeljon</a>, the first alternate from the River Vale, New Jersey qualifier, was added to the field on June 24 when the space reserved for the winner of the <a href="Walmart%20NW%20Arkansas%20Championship">Walmart NW Arkansas Championship</a> was not used because the winner, Inbee Park, had already qualified in multiple categories.
<a href="Amy%20Meier">Amy Meier</a>, the first alternate from the St. Louis qualifier, <a href="Lindy%20Duncan">Lindy Duncan</a>, the first alternate from the West Palm Beach, Florida qualifier, and <a href="Mikayla%20Harmon">Mikayla Harmon</a>, an amateur and the first alternate from the Glendale Arizona qualifier, were added to the field when <a href="Jeon%20Mi-jeong">Jeon Mi-jeong</a>, <a href="Bo-Mee%20Lee">Bo-Mee Lee</a>, and <a href="Sun-Ju%20Ahn">Sun-Ju Ahn</a>, who all qualified in category 12, declined to participate in the tournament.
<a href="Hannah%20Suh">Hannah Suh</a>, an amateur and the first alternate from the Daly City, California qualifier, was added to the field on June 25 when <a href="Ariya%20Jutanugarn">Ariya Jutanugarn</a>, who qualified in category 13, withdrew with a shoulder injury.
Course layout.
<br>
Round summaries.
First round.
"Thursday, June 27, 2013"
<a href="Kim%20Ha-Neul%20%28golfer%29">Kim Ha-Neul</a> shot a bogey-free 6-under-par 66 to lead by one stroke over <a href="Inbee%20Park">Inbee Park</a>. Park won the first two majors of the 2013 season, only <a href="Babe%20Zaharias">Babe Zaharias</a> in <a href="1950%20LPGA%20Tour">1950</a> has won the first three majors in a season. Defending champion <a href="Na%20Yeon%20Choi">Na Yeon Choi</a> shot 71 to tie for 17th.
Second round.
"Friday, June 28, 2013"<br>
"Saturday, June 29, 2013"
The second round was interrupted by fog on Friday afternoon with only 114 players completing their second rounds. Inbee Park, in the last group to finish Friday, was the clubhouse leader at 9-under-par.
Third round.
"Saturday, June 29, 2013"
Final round.
"Sunday, June 30, 2013"

"Final round"
